turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Chalk stream.
turn.1: What kind of fish are in the Chalk stream?
turn.2: The chalk streams hold a good number of wild salmonid fish species such as the brown trout ("Salmo trutta"), Atlantic salmon ("Salmo salar") and grayling ("Thymallus thymallus").
turn.3: Are there any other fish species?
turn.4: In addition to these there are also considerable numbers of stocked brown trout and stocked rainbow trout ("Oncorhynchus mykiss").
turn.5: Is fishing allowed in the Chalk stream?
turn.6: The rich invertebrate life and characteristic transparent shallow water make chalk rivers and streams particularly suited to fly fishing.
turn.7: What other resources are in the Chalk stream?
turn.8: Many of the chalk stream springs are also used as sites for watercress production, due to the constant temperature and clean, alkaline, mineral-rich spring water.
turn.9: Is watercress transported to other places?
turn.10: The Mid Hants Watercress Railway in Hampshire is so named on account of its use for transporting watercress to London from local chalk streams.
turn.11: Is the spring water used for anything else?
turn.12: A number of the chalk aquifers and associated groundwater sources related to chalk streams and rivers are used for water abstraction by local and national water utility companies.
